title: Part (a)(i)
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value 1) to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and 2) to score the response.

The response cannot contain more than one month as a response.

title: Part (a)(ii)
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value 1) to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and 2) to score the response.

The response can earn a point for this part even if it did not earn a point in (a)(i).
descriptions: The response does not indicate a value between 27 and 28 degrees Celsius.
The response indicates a value between 27 and 28 degrees Celsius.

title: Part (a)(iii)
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value 1) to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and 2) to score the response.

The response can earn a point in (a)(iii) even if it did not earn points in (a)(i) or (a)(ii).
descriptions: The response identifies neither higher average temperatures nor higher maximum temperatures as the difference between the two grasslands.
The response identifies higher average temperatures or higher maximum temperatures as the difference between the two grasslands.

title: Part (b)(i)
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value 1) to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and 2) to score the response.

The response must describe, not just identify, one way grazing animals help to maintain grassland ecosystems.
descriptions: The response does not describe any of the following ways that grazing animals help to maintain grassland ecosystems.
The response describes one of the following ways that grazing animals help to maintain grassland ecosystems.

title: Part (b)(ii)
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value 1) to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and 2) to score the response.

The response explains, using support for the claim, how seasonal fires benefit grassland ecosystems.
descriptions: The response does not provide any of the following explanations of how seasonal fires benefit grassland ecosystems.
The response provides one of the following explanations of how seasonal fires benefit grassland ecosystems.

title: Part (c)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value 1) to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and 2) to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not provide any of the following descriptions of why the conversion of grasslands to agricultural area is an environmental problem.
The response provides one of the following descriptions of why the conversion of grasslands to agricultural area is an environmental problem.
